channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. and Venezuela Jam Caribbean GPS Signals to Thwart Attacks, Raising Flight Hazard
item.description: Military brinkmanship between President Trump and Nicolás Maduro of Venezuela has led to an increase in electronic warfare in the region.

item.title: Bowen Yang Is Leaving ‘S.N.L.’ After This Weekend’s Episode
item.description: Yang has been part of the NBC sketch show since 2018, earning five Emmy nominations.

item.title: Tesla’s chief designer accidentally smashed a $61K Cybertruck’s ‘armor glass’ window with a metal ball. Now he says it was a ‘great marketing moment’
item.description: CEO Elon Musk claimed more than 200,000 orders for the vehicle following its botched reveal in 2019.

item.title: Gen Z is open minded about blue-collar work and the Fords of the economy need them — but both sides are missing each other
item.description: Clinton Crawford, an automotive technician, said college was pushed on his kids. “That’s good, if that’s for you, but I don’t think it’s for everyone....

item.title: James Talarico says the biggest ‘welfare queens’ in America are ‘the giant corporations that don’t pay a penny in income taxes’
item.description: The 2026 Senate hopeful says major corporations cost taxpayers far more than social safety net programs.

item.title: The White House Is Just ‘Trying to Keep Grandpa Busy’
item.description: Jamelle Bouie, Michelle Cottle and David French convene to discuss the year that was.

item.title: Hezbollah Is Down, but Not Out, as Lebanon Faces Pressure to Disarm It
item.description: The Lebanese militant group has resisted calls to lay down all its arms, risking a return to war with Israel.

item.title: ‘They’ll lose their humanity’: Dartmouth professor says he’s surprised just how scared his Gen Z students are of AI
item.description: A lot of Scott Anthony's students are excited to use AI, he told Fortune, but a meaningful portion are "scared full stop." They have "hesitation and f...

item.title: Natasha Lyonne says AI has an ethics problem because right now it’s ‘super kosher copacetic to rob freely under the auspices of acceleration’
item.description: Lyonne’s production company developed a tool for generating big screen-ready AI content.

item.title: 6 Takeaways From the First Batch of the Epstein Files
item.description: Many of the Justice Department documents were heavily redacted, and President Trump’s name was rarely mentioned. The White House also sought to make p...

item.title: Closing Arguments
item.description: Today, your highly personal, delightfully specific bests of 2025.

item.title: U.S. and Venezuela Jam Caribbean GPS Signals to Thwart Attacks, Raising Flight Hazard
item.description: Military brinkmanship between President Trump and Nicolás Maduro of Venezuela has led to an increase in electronic warfare in the region.

item.title: Hezbollah Is Down, but Not Out, as Lebanon Faces Pressure to Disarm It
item.description: The Lebanese militant group has resisted calls to lay down all its arms, risking a return to war with Israel.

item.title: U.S. Strikes on Syria Underscore Scale of Challenge for Its President
item.description: The Syrian government did not comment directly on the extensive American strikes targeting the Islamic State on Friday, but said it was intensifying i...

item.title: Sudanese Refugees Describe Their Escape From Darfur
item.description: No one knows the true toll of the massacre, and the city remains isolated. Now, refugee camps in Chad are flooded with newly displaced Sudanese.
